intro: Ruschia lavisii, commonly known as the Karoo star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often strikingly colored species. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring. Due to its hardy nature, it is well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments.
